1.text: After this, Job opened his mouth and cursed the day of his birth.

2.text: And this is what he said:

3.text: “May the day of my birth perish, and the night it was said, ‘A boy is conceived.’

4.text: If only that day had turned to darkness! May God above disregard it; may no light shine upon it.

5.text: May darkness and gloom reclaim it, and a cloud settle over it; may the blackness of the day overwhelm it.

6.text: If only darkness had taken that night away! May it not appear among the days of the year; may it never be entered in any of the months.

7.text: Behold, may that night be barren; may no joyful voice come into it.

8.text: May it be cursed by those who curse the day—those prepared to rouse Leviathan.

9.text: May its morning stars grow dark; may it wait in vain for daylight; may it not see the breaking of dawn.

10.text: For that night did not shut the doors of the womb to hide the sorrow from my eyes.

11.text: Why did I not perish at birth; why did I not die as I came from the womb?

12.text: Why were there knees to receive me, and breasts that I should be nursed?

13.text: For now I would be lying down in peace; I would be asleep and at rest

14.text: with kings and counselors of the earth, who built for themselves cities now in ruins,

15.text: or with princes who had gold, who filled their houses with silver.

16.text: Or why was I not hidden like a stillborn child, like an infant who never sees daylight?

17.text: There the wicked cease from raging, and there the weary find rest.

18.text: The captives enjoy their ease; they do not hear the voice of the oppressor.

19.text: Both small and great are there, and the slave is freed from his master.

20.text: Why is light given to the miserable, and life to the bitter of soul,

21.text: who long for death that does not come, and search for it like hidden treasure,

22.text: who rejoice and greatly exult when they reach the grave?

23.text: Why is life given to a man whose way is hidden, whom God has hedged in?

24.text: I sigh when food is put before me, and my groans pour out like water.

25.text: For the thing I feared has overtaken me, and what I dreaded has befallen me.

26.text: I am not at ease or quiet; I have no rest, for trouble has come.”
